result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roland Veshi

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Roland Veshi in court.  
Attorney Leah R. Thomas in court for Roland Veshi.  
Attorney Matthew Richard Westphal in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Scheduling Conference. 
Defense request a soft projected guilty. 
Duet o the co-defendant matter this case also  scheduled for final pretrial and jury trial dates. 
Court ordered parties to file their Pretrial documents 48 hours in advance of the final pretrial hearing.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Plea hearing scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jason Matthews in court.  
Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty in court for Jason Matthews.  
Attorney Matthew Richard Westphal in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Parties request an additional hearing advising the court they are still reviewing the voluminous discovery. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Roland Veshi in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas and Criag Mastantuono.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf Matthew Westphal.

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense requested adjournment to review Discovery. Case adjourned in Branch 45.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roland Veshi in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas and Craig Mastantuono.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Csae in court for a scheduling conference. Defense has all discovery. Defense requests a scheduling conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Sanders.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Kies, Br. 45.

Defendant Roland Veshi in court with Attorney Leah R. Thomas and Attorney Craig Mastantuono; parties appear by video.  Matthew Westphal appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roland Veshi in court with Attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Co-counsel has requested an adjournment in 22CF526; Attorney Mastantuono doesn't object to an adjournment and joins in the request. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with VerHalen, Inc. d/b/a Pella Windows and Doors and any employees of the company

Defendant Roland Veshi in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono, as friend of the court.  Defendant Roland Veshi in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Roland Veshi appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT PLANS TO RETAIN PRIVATE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
